plan:
1. Initial Bids: Start with moderate bids around 50% of my value. Gather data on competitors' bidding patterns.
2. Aggressive Bidding: Increase bids to 75% of my value for 3 rounds. Observe if this leads to winning more often and its impact on profits.
3. Conservative Bidding: Lower bids to 25% of my value for 3 rounds. Compare profitability with previous strategies.
4. Random Bidding: Bid randomly for 2 rounds to introduce unpredictability and see reactions.

1. Initial Rounds (1-3): Bid exactly my value, to understand competitors' bidding trends.
2. Middle Rounds (4-7): Bid aggressively, 10-15% above my value, to gather data on the upper limit of competitors' bids.
3. Round 8-10: Bid conservatively, 10-15% below my value, to understand the lower limit of competitors' bids.

1. Initial Rounds (1-3): Bid low (around 20% of my value) to gather data on opponents' bidding behaviors without risking too much.
2. Middle Rounds (4-9): Implement a more aggressive strategy, bidding around 70% of my value to increase winning chances, and observe reactions.
3. Late Rounds (10-12): Experiment with riskier bids, up to 90% of my value, to assess the potential for high profits.

Next, I will pursue an aggressive bidding strategy, bidding 75% of my value for 3 rounds. I will observe the impact on my win rate and profits. Then, I will switch to a conservative approach, bidding 25% of my value for 3 rounds, comparing profitability.

In the next round, I'll bid 50% of my value to test how conservative bids perform. In rounds 3-5, I'll bid 15% above my value to gauge competitors' maximum bids. In rounds 6-7, I'll bid my exact value to understand the average bidding behavior.

Continue with the strategy of bidding around 20% of my value for initial rounds. Analyze opponents' bidding patterns to understand their strategies. Adjust my bidding strategy in the middle rounds based on gathered data, aiming for a balance between risk and potential profit.

Continuing with my aggressive bidding strategy, I will bid 75% of my value for the next 2 rounds. Then, I will switch to conservative bidding, bidding 25% of my value for 3 rounds, to compare profitability.

In the next round, I'll bid 50% of my value to continue testing conservative bids. Then, I'll bid 15% above my value in rounds 4-5 to understand competitors' highest bids. In rounds 6-7, I'll bid my exact value to gauge average bidding behavior.

Continue with low bids (20% of value) for data gathering. In middle rounds, increase bids to 70% of value, observing reactions. Late rounds, experiment with riskier bids up to 90% of value. Adjust strategy based on opponents' patterns for potential high profits.

For the next round, I will continue my aggressive bidding strategy, bidding 75% of my value. However, I will subtract $2 from my bid to potentially increase my profit. After this round, I will switch to a conservative bidding strategy for 3 rounds to compare results.

For the next round, I'll bid exactly my value to gauge the average bidding behavior. In rounds 4-5, I'll bid 15% above my value to test aggressive bidding. In rounds 6-7, I'll bid 10% below my value to understand the lower limit of competitors' bids.

Transition into the middle round strategy: Bid around 70% of my value to increase my chances of winning. Monitor opponents' reactions to adjust my strategy. Explore riskier bids in late rounds based on previous rounds' data and outcomes.

Next, I'll maintain aggressive bidding of 75% of my value, but will subtract $2 to potentially increase profit. Afterwards, I'll switch to conservative bidding of 25% of my value for 3 rounds to compare results. I'll also observe competitors' bidding patterns closely.

For rounds 4-5, I'll bid 15% above my value to test aggressive bidding. In rounds 6-7, I'll bid 10% below my value to understand lower bid limits. For rounds 8-9, I'll bid my exact value again, and in the last rounds, I'll adjust my strategy based on collected data.

For the next rounds, I plan to increase my bids to around 70% of my value, as planned. This strategy aims to increase my chances of winning, while also observing how other bidders react to my more aggressive bids.

For the next 3 rounds, I'll adopt a conservative strategy, bidding 25% of my value. This will help me analyze if lower bids yield better profits. After that, I'll introduce randomness in my bids for 2 rounds to observe competitors' reactions and gather additional data.

For rounds 5-7, I'll bid 10% below my value to understand lower bid limits. In rounds 8-10, I'll bid my exact value. In the final rounds, I'll use a hybrid approach, bidding 5% above or below my value based on previous round data.

I'll continue bidding around 70% of my value for the next few rounds. I'll also closely monitor the highest and second highest bids to gauge if a more aggressive strategy, such as bidding closer to my value, could yield better results.

I'll continue with the conservative strategy, bidding 25% of my value for the next 2 rounds. Then, I'll introduce randomness in my bids for 2 rounds. This will help me gauge the impact of unpredictability on competitors' bidding patterns and my profit margins.

For rounds 6-7, I'll bid 10% below my value to understand lower limits. In rounds 8-10, I'll bid my exact value. In the final rounds, I'll bid 5% above or below my value based on previous round data, aiming to maximize profit.

For the next rounds, I plan to adjust my bids to be closer to the second highest bids from previous rounds. I'll continue bidding aggressively, but will also consider the range of other bids to maximize profits. I'll experiment with bids up to 90% of my value in late rounds.

I'll persist with conservative bidding, bidding 25% of my value in the next round. Then, I'll switch to random bids within a range of 25% to 75% of my value for 2 rounds to observe the impact on my profits and competitors' behavior.

For rounds 7-9, I'll bid my exact value to gauge average bidding behavior. In rounds 10-12, I'll bid 20% above my value to test aggressive bidding. For the final rounds, I'll choose a balanced approach, bidding 10% above or below my value based on previous round results.

Maintain aggressive bidding around 70% of my value. Analyze second highest bids and adjust my bids accordingly to save more. In upcoming rounds, experiment with bids close to 90% of my value to potentially secure higher profits.

In the next round, I'll continue with my conservative strategy, bidding 25% of my value. Afterwards, I'll experiment with a variable bidding strategy, where I bid between 50% to 100% of my value based on the round number, to assess its impact on my profit and competitors' reactions.

For rounds 8-10, I'll bid my exact value to understand average behavior. In rounds 11-13, I'll bid 20% above my value to test aggressive bidding. For the final rounds, I'll bid 10% below my value to understand lower limits and adjust based on previous results.

In the upcoming rounds, I plan to slightly increase my bids to around 75% of my value to further test the waters. I'll continue to analyze the second highest bids and adjust my strategy accordingly to maximize potential profits.

For the next two rounds, I'll experiment with a variable bidding strategy, bidding between 50% to 100% of my value based on the round number. This should provide valuable insights into the impact of bid variability on winning probability and profit margins.

For rounds 9-10, I'll bid my exact value for consistent data. In rounds 11-13, I'll bid 20% above my value to test aggressive bidding. For the final rounds, I'll bid 10% below my value to understand lower limits and adjust based on previous results.

In the next rounds, I plan to closely track second highest bids to calibrate my own bid, aiming to bid slightly above that. This strategy minimizes expenditure while maintaining winning chances. I'll also experiment with bids up to 85% of my value to assess effects on opponents' behaviors and profits.

For the next 3 rounds, I'll implement a variable strategy, bidding between 60-80% of my value. I'll then spend the final 3 rounds bidding aggressively at 90% of my value, to test if higher bids increase winning probability and profit margins. I'll also closely monitor competitors' bidding patterns.

For rounds 10-12, I'll bid 20% above my value to test aggressive bidding. In the final rounds, I'll bid 10% below my value to understand lower limits. I'll adjust my strategy based on the performance of these tactics.

In the next rounds, I'll bid closer to the second highest bid from previous rounds, targeting around 80-85% of my value. I'll continue to adjust based on opponents' behaviors to maximize potential profits.

For the next three rounds, I'll bid 60-80% of my value to test the effectiveness of moderate-aggressive bidding. For the final two rounds, I'll bid aggressively at 90% of my value to evaluate the impact on winning probability and profit margins.

For rounds 11-13, I'll continue bidding 20% above my value to test aggressive bidding. In the final rounds, I'll switch to a conservative strategy, bidding 10% below my value to understand lower limits. I'll adjust my tactics based on these results to maximize profit.

For the next rounds, I'll experiment with bidding around 80-90% of my value, still maintaining an aggressive strategy. I'll closely track the second highest bids and adjust my own bid accordingly, aiming for a balance between winning chances and potential profits.

For the next two rounds, I'll continue bidding 60-80% of my value. In the last round, I'll bid aggressively at 90% of my value. I'll monitor competitors' patterns to adjust my bidding strategy if needed.

For rounds 12-13, I'll bid 20% above my value to continue the aggressive strategy. In round 14, I'll switch to a conservative approach, bidding my value minus the difference between the highest and second highest bids from the previous rounds. This aims to maximize my profit.

In the upcoming rounds, I'll continue with aggressive bidding around 85% of my value. I will also monitor the second highest bids closely and adjust my bid accordingly, aiming to maximize potential profits while maintaining a winning chance.

For the next round, I'll bid 70% of my value, aiming to strike a balance between aggressive and conservative strategies. In the final round, I'll bid 90% of my value to test the effectiveness of aggressive bidding in winning auctions and increasing profits.

For round 13, I'll maintain the aggressive strategy, bidding 20% above my value. In the final round, I'll adopt a conservative approach, bidding my value minus the average difference between the highest and second highest bids from the previous rounds to potentially increase profit.

In the next rounds, I'll maintain aggressive bidding of 85% of my value. I'll also experiment with bidding within $5-$10 above the second highest bid from previous rounds to increase winning chances while potentially maximizing profits.

For the final round, I'll adopt an aggressive strategy, bidding 90% of my value. This will test the effectiveness of high bidding in winning auctions and maximizing profits. I'll also assess competitors' reactions to this strategy.

In the final round, I'll adopt a conservative strategy, bidding my value minus the average difference between the highest and second highest bids from the previous rounds. This aims to maximize profit while reducing the risk of overpayment.

In the final round, I'll bid aggressively, around 90% of my value. I'll also consider bidding slightly above the second highest bid from previous rounds, aiming to maximize winning chances while maintaining a reasonable profit margin. I'll adjust based on opponents' behaviors.
